description: From scrupulous +‎ -ly, from Middle French scrupuleux, from Latin scrūpulōsus (“careful, scrupulous”), from scrūpulus (“anxiety, uneasiness”), diminutive from scrūpus (“sharp stone; anxiety”) + -ulus.

adverbs.description: scrupulously (comparative more scrupulously, superlative most scrupulously)

entries.meaning: In a careful manner, with scruple; done with careful attention to detail.
